column2: rainsong66, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: went to Emergency room, doc gave me IV inj of 60 mg of solu-medrol plus benedryl plus 50 demerol.within 15 minutes migrain was gone. have had migraines since I was 5, am now 56 this is a first that something worked this fast.

column2: c , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Son died severe negative reactions : seizures, fast heart rate, slow wound healing, sudden high blood sugar & diabetic, extreme swelling eyes, face, whole body, bruising & discoloration face, legs, whole body, rash, rapid weight gain & fluid retention, bleeding ulcer that perforated, low platelets, abdominal distention, fever & chills,  trouble urinating & finally cardiac arrest ..2 gastroenterologists& 1 TRAUMA surgeon said caused by solumedrol given for pneumonia ..should have been weaned off after 2-3 weeks.Son died given for pneumonia ..should have been weaned off after 2-3 weeks. Caused seizures, rapid heart rate, slow wound healing, high blood sugar & sudden diabetic symptoms, rapid extreme swelling face, eyes, legs, whole body,, abdominal distention, low platelets, bruising & discoloration, rapid weight gain, rash, Bleeding Ulcers that perforated into abdominal cavity, fever & chills & finally cardiac arrest

column2: Solumedrol, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Excessive discomfort with fluid retention,increase blood pressure and swelling of the extremeties and abdomen and stomach,GI heartburn/discomfort,hemmorhoids, eye/vision difficulties,joint pain and disfiguration

column2: Grahamr13, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My wife took this for optic neuritis from encephalitis. At first it wasn't horrible but felt worse as the week went on. Still waiting on intended results hoping it hasn't created another infection? Did find that citrus ( orange,lemon) removes the taste problems though!!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: experienced sleeplessness and headache after use, breathing significantly improved.

column2: 357sig, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Told Docs at hosp that if they had to give me any drug that stimulates my adrenal glands, they would need to strap me down and knock me out. One day they might listen to me. 1.5 hrs after starting IV drip, I went bezerk. Sweating,rage, headache,muscle pain, got so upset I walked out of the hosp. and put my fist in a metal stop sign which tore it off it's metal pole. like taking a shot of pure speed. Hosp security brought me the sign as a momento! When will they ever learn that we know our bodies better then they and that every person is diffirent.

column2: kat, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I did the first run pre-diagnosis. I was losing my vision at an alarming rate. I did my first day and then went out with my mom. I was actually scared when someone showed up in my periphial vision because it had been months. I was overjoyed with the results and I am no looking forward to my next run this week for my left side weakness and vision problems because I know it will help. Side effects are bearable. I was super hyper but, my neuro offset that with Xanax, which really helped. The only unexpected was that I had to remove the IV myself. I have a friend who is an EMT so he did it for me, but I would have freaked out if I had to do it myself!

column2: lolojp81, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with a sinus infection. I also have MS. The infection caused my optical nerve to swell which is causing blurred vision and pain. I was given iv drips of solu medrol for 5 days and have seen little to no change in my progress.

column2: Mammabee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I find that what every one is sayiny is correct, I feel great from the ms part, but the side effects from this drug are horrible I dont like the way I feel from it, very dizzy weak and not myself it has only been 3 days since I have been off the drug, all I can say is I hope it gets better!!!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: No physical side effects noted, but white blood cell count jumped from 10000 to 20000 in one day.  This is just the second day of treatment on IV solumedrol

column2: gabe2009, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My husband was given solu medrol injections because he has COPD and cannot breathe. This drug caused him to be combative, unreasonable, argumentative, someetimes staring into space and cannot hear what is being said to him. Recently, I asked the doctor to take him off prednizone which has some horrible side effects and the dr. put him on this solu medrol which is worse thn anything I have ever witnessed. I feel as if I should report the doctor due to giving my husband bad and dangerous drugs.

column2: kabreez24, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Always leaves a bad taste and muscle aches at withdrawl time but well worth the relief from the MS syptoms.  I have had everything from weak legs to dizziness to optic neuritis and it always clears things up withing a day or so to a week.  Warn your friends about mood swings and stay positive :)

column2: thereseg79, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a 3 day high dose IV course to treat optic nueritis.  It made the eye pain go away. Still waiting on vision loss to recover.  I have the worser heart palpitations, headache, dizziness, and stomach upset ever.  I hate it.

column2: Bill86404, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: 2nd series in 7 months.  3 days x  1gm via IV in 250ml .9% sodium chloride drip.  Typical side effects.  Bad taste, increased anxiety, some insomnia.   Results - walking ability greatly improved, pain diminished.  Other MS symptoms diminished (I have a lot of the symptoms).  Overall I hate IV but I do this because the results are so substantial for me.  It has been the only real relief I get.  Prednizone (sp) also gave some relief to symptoms but quickly diminished within a day of last oral med dosage.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: sisopixie, 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: allergic to it

column2: ojaigirl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: DC'd Enbrel due to chemo for colon cancer. Chemo ceased, also ceased to control RA. Began MTX (no more TNF drugs for me!!!) and after 5 weekly shots still had no symptom control -- rheumatologist prescribed 2 days of (I believe 100 units)solu-medrol infusion and I got nasty urtecaria during infusion. Given benadryl, zyrtec and zantac and control achieved, almost normal 5 hours later. I am researching online & almost all sites say anaphylaxis and urtecaria are uncommon but known reactions. Dr. does not believe solu-medrol was cause. I disagree!

column2: lmarsden, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: bad taste in mouth for days....got really sick the last day of treatment....muscles hurt all over....i am not sure if i would do it again

column2: chieyann, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: this is a lot easier then taking a load of pills or having to do injections in the stomach or anywhere else.....horrible taste...nothing takes the test away...but its well worth it, thought i would never feel my leg again but this medication has proved me wrong every time i had an episode....

column2: RITA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

racyralph, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: having copd is what it is all about, and i have had it for quite some time now.  the med absolutely relieves me of my cough and scrabblled throat. no fever, and a great sense of being worthy of life again. thanks

column2: racyralph, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: copd patient, useless to try anything else when this does the trick, so far

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy. It stabilized my condition enough to return to work after an eight month absence. I continue treatment by 1g IV at six week intervals. Side effects are manageable. Diagnosis was July 2008 and treatment via IVIG was without success. Solu-Medrol began September 2008 and continues.

My husband received 125mg Solumedrol the day after being stung by a bee because his hand was swollen.  An hour after the drug was administered, he went into cardiac arrest and passed away.  He was 43 with no heart problems.  Safe?  I don't think so.

column2: margaret621, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: takes an hour to find a good vein. leaves a terrible taste.  cannot drink waterm it tastes so bad.  but other than that so far so good.

column2: McMegan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This shot hurts.  Similar to a tetnis shot, be prepared.

column2: raerae977, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It stopped my symptoms immediately. Does leave a bad taste in your mouth and I have swollen all over and I have some stomach trouble because of the treatment, but the side effects aren't near as bad as not being able to walk or move. Would do it again when needed.

column2: ttmarch03, 25-34 Female  (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug did not work for me at all. 5 minutes after I received it through IV my entire body went stiff followed by muscle spasms that lasted over 2 hours and took over an hour to correct with additional drugs! Needless to say the next day I woke up feeling like I'd run a marathon-my muscles were so sore from the contractions that the medicine caused. After all this the DR informed me that solumedrol has many side effects and I was probably allergic. Be careful!

column2: divechik, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
